name: Chocolate Blueberry Zucchini Bread
description: Getting my super picky kids to eat vegetables is always a challenge. My oldest loves chocolate and my youngest loves blueberries, so I combined the two into one recipe. I used a blend of whole wheat and white flours, added some flax seed, and tried to keep both sugar and fat content on the lower end. Enjoy!
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, or to taste
½ cup unsweetened baking cocoa (such as Ghirardelli®)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 2 loaf pans.

Whisk white sugar, oil, eggs, brown sugar, and vanilla extract together in a large bowl. Fold in grated zucchini. Add 1 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, flaxseed meal, cocoa, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cardamom; mix until batter is combined.
Combine blueberries and 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour in a small bowl; toss to combine.
Fold blueberry mixture gently into the batter. Pour batter into loaf pans, filling each one 2/3 full.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of each loaf comes out clean, 45 minutes to 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: Amazing!!!! I used chocolate chips instead...and extra blueberries!! Thank you for recipe!

Very moist, looked just like the picture. Didn’t think it had a lot of flavor. Not chocolatey or blueberry!  Kinda bland. Maybe it needed chocolate chips or maybe a flavored cream cheese. I like my zucchini bread better. Not sure I would make it again.

It’s a very good recipe, HOWEVER I used the recipe from the Allrecipes.com magazine which suggested I use one 9x5 loaf pan or two 8x4 loaf pans. I had only one 9x5 loaf pan and the batter completely filled it up. Stupidly, I went ahead and put it in the oven with a cookie sheet underneath. I have now baked it at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 50 minutes and the raw dough is still cascading over the side of the loaf pan onto the cookie sheet. Please change this! Next time I will use TWO 9x5 loaf pans!

This was okay. I used 2 8x4 pans and baked for 50 min. I used Splenda in place of the white sugar and replaced half the oil with apple sauce. I felt like it could have been a bit sweeter and the zucchini taste was lost in the cocoa flavor. Next time I might add chocolate chips as another reviewer suggested.

THESE.  ARE. AMAZING!! Quick tid bit: it says to mix the ingredients until just wet. LITERALLY, do not mix it any longer. I made two batches and accidentally mixed the second one too long. It was still good, but not as good as the first batch. Also, I switched the sugars for extra flavor and added a little more vanilla. I also made some oatmeal cinnamon strudel to top them off... I came into the kitchen and my husband said, "If you're going to give some of these away I suggest you bag and hide them. I've already eaten like seven!" Definitely a recipe to save, for sure!!

This is a really lovely, and unique bread. The flavor is just wonderful--very chocolatey, with the perfect amount of spice from the cinnamon and cardamom, and then there's a nice brightness you get from the blueberries. I took the recipe submitter's advice and used half oil and half applesauce to cut down on the fat a little bit. The zucchini I used was quite large, so I ended up with 3 1/2 cups grated zucchini. I added it all to the batter, and it created no problems. I also had a 1/2 cup dark chocolate chips that I've been wanting to get used up, so I threw those in too--and they made a great addition also. I baked my loaves in two 8 1/2x 4 1/2" pans, and only baked them at 350  to avoid the outsides getting overdone. They were perfectly baked in 55 minutes. Thank you so much for this recipe, I very much enjoy that I got 2 loaves out of it, and I can't wait to make it again.
